## Air Quality

@fig-airquality further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(thematic)
library(bslib)
library(showtext)

font_add_google('Lato','Lato')
showtext_auto()

rainbow_theme = function(){
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = 'Lato', size = 12),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(colour = "#7700b3"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(colour = "#7700b3"),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#1A0933"),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#1A0933"),
    
    axis.line = element_line(colour = "white"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(colour = "white"),

    axis.title = element_text(colour = "white"),
    axis.text = element_text(colour = "ghostwhite"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(colour = "white"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(colour = "white"),
    
    legend.text = element_text(colour = "white"),
    legend.title = element_text(colour = "white"),
    legend.background = element_rect(fill = NA)
  )
  
}


 
    
    

library(ggplot2)

thematic::thematic_shiny()

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone, col= Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess") + 
  rainbow_theme()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Temperature and ozone level.](CodeBlog_files/figure-html/fig-airquality-1.png){#fig-airquality width=672}
:::
:::

# Star Wars data

::: {.cell width='10' fig.showtext='true'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(paletteer)

starwars = starwars

ggplot(
  starwars,
  aes(x= height, y= eye_color, color=height)
)+
  geom_point(size= 2)+
  scale_color_paletteer_c(`"ggthemes::Orange"`)+
  rainbow_theme()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](CodeBlog_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=2100}
:::
:::

The Star Wars has many blue and brown eyed characters
